abstract: Native Americans address historically poor oral health on reservations by invoking tribal sovereignty to empower dental therapists; workers trained to perform basic tasks are illegal in most states and opposed by dentists; tribes are encouraged by results, despite therapists' lack of formal degree in dentistry.
lead_paragraph: Poor oral health is rampant among American Indian communities. The Swinomish Tribe in Washington opened a clinic on their land to expand access to treatment.

headline.main: Where Dentists Are Scarce, American Indians Forge a Path to Better Care
headline.print_headline: Asserting Tribal Sovereignty to Improve Indians’ Dental Care

snippet: Poor oral health is rampant among American Indian communities. The Swinomish Tribe in Washington opened a clinic on their land to expand access to treatment.
